elements.name: intro_hastings
elements.html:
Built in 1961, Hastings Middle School has had several additions over the years, most recently in 1978.

Earlier this year, a team of engineers and architects identified the following challenges with the building:

  • Roof, HVAC system, windows, and flooring need replacement.
  • Lighting, plumbing, electrical, and security systems need repair or replacement.
  • Many classrooms are smaller than state-recommended sizes; athletic spaces and music rooms are also too small. There are few spaces where students and teachers can work in small groups.
  • Old HVAC units in classrooms make it hard for students to hear.
  • Science labs and safety equipment are outdated.

Here are three ways that the UA School District could address these issues.

Each option is shown below in full. Click Evaluate this option under any box to share your opinion.

elements.name: desc_option1
elements.html:
• Replace roof, HVAC, windows, flooring, and other outdated systems.
  • No changes will be made to the school’s layout, to classroom sizes, or to athletic spaces.

Total Construction Cost: $59.7 million ($208/year per $500K home value)
Timeline: Summer breaks

elements.name: support_option1
elements.title: How much do you support or oppose the idea of the Upper Arlington School District repairing Hastings in the way described in Option 1?

elements.name: desc_option2
elements.html:
• Build a new school to the west of the current site and then demolish the current building.
  • All challenges with the current building will be addressed. For example, the windows, flooring, roof, HVAC, and other systems will be new, and classrooms, athletic spaces, and music rooms will be larger. Overall, this building will match the quality of other UA Schools’ buildings.

Total Construction Cost: $110.8 million ($341/year per $500K home value)
Timeline: 2 academic years + summer breaks

elements.name: support_option2
elements.title: How much do you support or oppose the idea of the Upper Arlington School District rebuilding Hastings in the way described in Option 2?

elements.name: desc_option3
elements.html:
• Demolish current building and then build a new school on the current site.
  • Students will use temporary, modular classrooms while the new school is built.
  • All challenges with the current building will be addressed. For example, the windows, flooring, roof, HVAC, and other systems will be new, and classrooms, athletic spaces, and music rooms will be larger. Overall, this building will match the quality of other UA Schools’ buildings.

Total Construction Cost: $130.4 million ($401/year per $500K home value)
Timeline: 2.5 academic years + summer breaks
